intro: Microlicia ascendens, commonly known as the climbing microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, elliptical leaves that are usually dark green in color. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
